comments.body: There's a type missing. Something like `type: bool`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +90,94 @@    version_added: 2.8
    description:
      - Restrict external access to the network.
    type: bool
    default: null

comments.body: Does `inspect_network()` work both with the network's name and the network's ID?

https://github.com/docker/docker-py/blob/master/docker/api/network.py#L189

docker-py assumes that a network's ID is being passed to it, but according to [1], both a network's name and network's ID is accepted on the endpoint being called in this inspect_network() function.


[1] : https://docs.docker.com/engine/api/v1.24/#35-networks
I would interpret it that way too. That's something we should test in an integration test, though ;)
Definitely! @felixfontein, I'm not familiar with integration testing with the Ansible codebase but I would love trying to work on a few tests.
